intro: Mascagnia rigida, commonly known as the rigid mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Mascagnia rigida is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
